sense.gloss: weariness, fatigue, languor, boredom, tedium, ennui
to get tired of, to lose interest in, to be fed up with, to have enough
to tire of, to lose interest in
to grow weary, to get tired of
physical weariness, sense of fatigue, washed-out feeling
stage of ennui (esp. in one's married life), period of lassitude, lethargic period, rut
to get tired of (doing), to lose interest in
to tire of, to lose interest in, to be too much for one, to find unmanageable, to be beyond one's control, to not know what to do with
to be at a loss, to rack one's brains in vain, to think and think but get nowhere, to fail to come up with a good idea
to be at a loss how to continue, to become disheartened
to rack one's brains without getting anywhere, to mull over endlessly, to be unable to make up one's mind
to give up searching (for someone or something)

sdata.j: オルダス・ハックスリーが↑人間↑↓にんげん↓のもっとも↑危険↑↓きけん↓な↑条件↑↓じょうけん↓だと↑考↑↓かんが↓えたのは↑倦怠↑↓けんたい↓であった。
sdata.e: It was boredom that Aldous Huxley considered one of the most dangerous human conditions.

sdata.j: ↑均整↑↓きんせい↓とは↑倦怠↑↓けんたい↓のことだ。
↑倦怠期↑↓けんたいき↓らしいです。
sdata.e: It seems that they're bored of married life.
